fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-57208].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*
Allow JIRA Admin to schedule Mail Handler. 

Currently in JIRA if users use more than 1 Mail Handler, all off it works at same time which could cause some congestion. Users would like option to schedule the Mail Handler so each of them get active at specific time.

For example lets say there are 3 Mail Handler:

Mail Handler 1 get active and deactivated after 1 minutes.
Mail Handler 2 get active after Mail Handler 1 is deactivated.
Mail Handler 3 get active after Mail Handler 2 is deactivated.
Mail Handler 1 get active after Mail Handler 3 is deactivated.
The cycles continues while JIRA is running.

In a way, each Mail Handler works periodically for 1 minutes while having specific time delay.

Also user would like option to set maximum number of IMAP connections in Mail Handler.

*Suggested Solution*
Currently in JIRA setting specific time delay still makes all the Mail Handler to be activated all the time. User would like option in Mail Handler to schedule how long each Mail Handler is active 

*Workaround*
Currently there are no workaround for this.
fields.summary: Schedule Mail Handler
You are not permitted to perform this operation.
Regarding configuring Jira dashboards via email

fields.description:
Dear Experts,
We want to migrate JIRA from cloud to standalone JIRA because we are comfortable with standalone and we are buying license now.
In this process I tried to to download the same cloud version (JIRA 7.1.0) but which is not avaiable in the market place or not launched yet.
But I still want to setup JIRA with cloud data, so I downloaded the latest JIRA standalone version 7.0.4 and while importing data the system thrown a warning message stating "You are trying to import data from JIRA 7.1.0 which higher version than present".
But still I proceeded anyway to imported the data and did re-indexing, but JIRA Agile, Import, Export system options gone. So, I am not able to use Greenhopper which is mandatory.
I have attached the error image to this issue.
So, kindly help us on priority for complete import data from cloud to in house.
fields.summary: Migrating data from cloud JIRA 7.1.0 to standalone JIRA 7.0.4 then Agile features missing

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-50052].

h3. Problem Definition
The notification for incompatible applications only shows up in {{JIRA Administration >> Applications >> Versions & licenses}} therefore administrators may missed it, if they did not navigate to the page.

!versions_and_licenses.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Sends an email reminder to administrators about the incompatibility.
fields.summary: Email notification for incompatible applications

  {panel}

There is this popup which comes up with suggestions of old Issues
But i am never able to get out of that screen or close the pop up to go ahead and continue created a help request

Using Chrome as my browser

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47767].
  {panel}

OK.

I've looked for about 15 minutes searching around and haven't found the answer.

I'm rolling out JIRA at Siemens and two of my big sells are that we will reduce email traffic and kill the use of spreadsheets for managing workload.

Initially the system notifications to email are ok, but I'm left thinking why is there not a notifications space, facebook, twitter, etc... they rarely send you emails.

You spend time on the system and a little (1) pops up in the top and you can see someone has commented on something you're watching.

This is vital, surely you've thought of this already? ;)
fields.summary: Notification area - Stop Sending Emails!!! :)

Can you check on this issue


Thanks 
Chandru
+91 9632492654

fields.description:
Dear Experts,

We want to migrate JIRA from cloud to standalone JIRA because we are comfortable with standalone and we are buying license now.

In this process I tried to to download the same cloud version (JIRA 7.1.0) but which is not avaiable in the market place or not launched yet.

But I still want to setup JIRA with cloud data, so I downloaded the latest JIRA standalone version 7.0.4 and while importing data the system thrown a warning message stating "You are trying to import data from JIRA 7.1.0 which higher version than present".

But still I proceeded anyway to imported the data and did re-indexing, but JIRA Agile, Import, Export system options gone. So, I am not able to use Greenhopper which is mandatory.

I have attached the error image to this issue.

So, kindly help us on priority for complete import data from cloud to in house.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47751].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The Attach Screenshot menu item was removed in JIRA 7. However, it still remains available in the dot dialog on the view issue page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to an issue.
# Press {{.}} with the keyboard.
# Type "Attach"
# _BUG_ The "Attach Screenshot" menu item appears.

h3. Expected Results

# The "Attach Screenshot" menu item does not appear.

h3. Actual Results

# _BUG_ The "Attach Screenshot" menu item appears.
fields.summary: Attach Screenshot menu item still available via the dot dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47750].
  {panel}

I populated a "Product Owner" Project Role with 2 Users.
I gave "Product Owner" "Administer Projects" permission.

One of the 2 users could NOT Create Sprints - because the icon was greyed out.

I gave that Single User "Administer Project" permission.

The icon was no longer greyed.

I toggled back & forth between removing & adding "Administer Projects" permission to that Single User.  The icon was greyed out when they didn't have "Single User" grant of "Administer Project" permission, and was NOT greyed out when they DID have permission as Single User.

I removed the Single User grant.

I tried the Permission Helper.
And this particular user - who no longer had "Single User" grant, but did have "Project Role" grant - came up as Green Checkmark with Permission Helper, the user had "Manage Sprints" permission, as I expected.  But the "Create Sprint" icon was still greyed out.
fields.summary: User can't "Create Sprint" even though member of Project Role with Administer Projects permission
Incorrect navigation instructions on how to get to Application links page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47747].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When using category not in (value1,value2) JQL does not return results where projects don't have a value for a category. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a few test projects.
# Create a project two categories i.e. test1 & test2.
# Add project a to category test1.
# Run a JQL query category not in (test2).

h3. Expected Results
JQL query should return all results where category doesn't = test 2. 

h3. Actual Results

It only includes projects that are test1 and it excludes all projects that do not have a category specified. 
 

h3.Workaround

In order for it to work correctly you have to include category not in (test2) OR category is empty.
fields.summary: When using category not in it excludes projects with no category value.
Automatic completing doesn't work with a specific user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Based on JRA-5189

Right now you can sort statuses using the up/down arrows but that takes so much longer than it needs to. 

Can we please have auto-sort options (by name/category), or re-use the same sorting option for Issue Type lists (drag and drop).

Thanks!
fields.summary: Make sorting statuses easier

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47741].
  {panel}

Hi,

there was a feature request at our company that the navbar should be fixed to top like that:
http://getbootstrap.com/examples/navbar-fixed-top/

Maybe worth a checkbox flag under "Look and Feel" section?

Meanwhile we're using custom CSS like this
{code}.aui-header
{ background: #205081 none repeat scroll 0 0; border-bottom: 1px solid #2e3d54; box-sizing: border-box; color: #fff; height: 40px; left: 0; padding: 0 10px; position: fixed !important; top: 0; width: 100%; z-index: 115; }{code}

Cheers
fields.summary: Fix navbar to top when scrolling

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47736].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
If an Admin specifies a project to allow users who are currently not JIRA Users to create their issues in via email, the project in question is visible to all users who are members of the default jira users group or any group.

There is unfortunately no way to way to restrict which users are able to see the project as users created from email are always added to the jira-users group [as stated here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/creating-issues-and-comments-from-email-185729464.html].

*Feature*
Can a feature be added to the incoming email form that allows users specify which group the users should be added to as this ensures that, other users who do not need to see the project do not have access to it.
* Add a field that allows user specify group that would be able to view the project or 
* Add the group specified in the browse project permission as the group that the users are created in along with the default JIRA users group which would help ensure that the user can view their issues however other users who do not belong to this group would not be able to see the project.
fields.summary: Add a feature that allows users specify group which users created from incoming mail are added to

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47735].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a JIRA Server user, it's possible to disable the Log Work option in Add-ons but specifies this is not possible in Cloud:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+disable+the+Log+Work+option+in+JIRA

Customers would like to disable in Cloud if they plan to use the Tempo Log Work option instead.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Cloud users to disable the Log Work option from JIRA
fields.summary: As an admin, ability to disable Log Work button in JIRA Cloud
test

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47729].
  {panel}

h4. Summary

Previously in JIRA 6.3.x the assign to field had focus, so user could just start typing. This behaviour change since 7.0 where the assign to field does not have focus.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7 onwards

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open any JIRA issue
# Click 'Assign' button

h3. Expected Results

The assign to field should have focus just like in previous version before 7.0.

h3. Actual Results

The assign to field does not have focus.
 
h3.Workaround

Click on the drop down button to select the assignee.
fields.summary: Assignee field does not have focus

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47728].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently , JIRA doesn't support viewing SVG image from JIRA . So , admin would like to raised a feature to render SVG image to PNG image from JIRA . Then send email notifications using PNG format.

h3. Suggested Solution
Auto render SVG image format to PNG when adding comment or attachment.

h3. Workaround 
Download the files from attachment then view it using SVG supported application or via online . For example http://www.rapidtables.com/web/tools/svg-viewer-editor.htm .
fields.summary: As admin, would like SVG image format render to PNG format when sending email notifications
Auto-suggest issue keys in editor
Make comments inline-editable
Linking to a comment does not work as advertised

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47720].
  {panel}

I recently discovered the statusCategory field which is very useful.

Can you please create a typeCategory that would be custom defined?

* bugs
* features
* maintenance
* new development
* etc...

Categories could overlap

Thanks for considering.
Adel
fields.summary: Create issue type category
Edit story points in list view
Combine drag-and-drop steps in pop-up
Request during 'upgrade/updates'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47715].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the *Create Branch* feature in the *Development Panel* only links to BitBucket Cloud or BitBucket Server (previously known as Stash). The suggestion ticket to allow the creation of branch in Github, *[JRA-35175|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-35175]*, has also been closed as it is not in Atlassian's roadmap. 

It is confusing for customers who would like to create branches in Github instead of BitBucket when they are presented with the option to BitBucket.

h3. Suggested Solution
Hide the option to *Create Branch* in the *Development Panel* if the on available DVCS connection is to Github.

h3. Workaround 
None at the moment.
fields.summary: Hide "Create Branch" from Development Panel when DVCS connection is only to Github

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47713].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian,

we need do give some users the permission to view the members of some groups.

eg.

_User A_ needs to view the members of _Group A, C, D, X,_
_User B_ needs to view the members of _Group B, C, E, F_
_User C_ needs to view the members of _*all* Groups,_
and so on...

Is it possible to add this feature??

This Feature was also requested by JRA-12211.
But JRA-12211 was untruly closed as an duplicate of JRA-11009 *but it isn't quite*!

Cheers,
Marcel
fields.summary: Need to make Members of Groups visible to non-administrators
Ability to display filters and dashboards of archived projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47711].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when an issue is cloned or splitted, the Status field is not retained. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Give the customer the option if we could like to retain the Status field during Issue Cloning or splitting.

h3. Why this is important
* If user clone the issue together with the sub-tasks, the status for the sub-tasks is not updated. Users are required to manually update the statuses which is time consuming.
fields.summary: As a User, I want JIRA give us the option to retain status when cloning or splitting an Issue.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47706].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
User wishes to view the statistic of issues based on *Components* from different projects through Issue Statistic Gadget. There are  components in the projects, and the statistic is shown separately.

!Screenshot from 2015-12-09 134046.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Feature request
The component with the same name from different projects should categorize as one.
fields.summary: Categorize Components with the Same Name from Different Projects as One

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47704].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

At https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/browsing-a-project-s-versions-203392044.html content and screenshot make confusion for customer since document never mentions about JIRA Agile projects.

So when customer compares the content with their own product they can't see Releases Active Sprints and etc. Since they are having JIRA Core project.

h3. Solution 

In JIRA Core or Service desk project if we add version to the project then we can have the release tab. 
So maybe we can provide steps to add versions before screenshot then it leads to less confusion.
fields.summary: Need To Mention JIRA Agile Project
I'm requested to enter Credit Cart while team has less than 5 members

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47702].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently JIRA ships with a bundled JRE, which will highly useful does not contain diagnostic tools (such as {{jstack}}) that are required for performance troubleshooting, and diagnosing other problems. Admins need to install a JDK to use these tools, which during problematic periods (such as outages) can become a blocker as other teams may maintain servers.

It's a big friction point for customers that we could avoid by providing a JDK that already has those tools.

h3. Suggested Solution

Ship JIRA with a JDK instead of a JRE.
 
h3. Workaround 

Install a JDK from http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html.
fields.summary: Ship JIRA with a JDK instead of a JRE
"Upgrade task list" on "Migration Hub" doesn't mention migrating customizations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47700].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
In previous versions of JIRA, the most recent selected tab when editing a transition would be remembered upon re-opening the transition or opening new browser tabs to edit other transitions while in the same session. Currently, when clicking on a transition to edit it, the Triggers tab is automatically selected regardless of previous selection. When performing an action on a different tab, the page is then refreshed and is back on the Triggers tab. This causes inconvenience when performing changes to multiple transitions, or performing multiple changes on a different tab.

h3. Environment
* v7.1.0-OD-02-030

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a Workflow
# Click on a transition to Edit it
# Select a different tab on this page, for example Conditions
# Navigate back to the Edit Workflow page
# Attempt to re-open the same Transition to edit it, or open a new Transition to Edit
# Each time a new transition is opened up, the Triggers tab is selected by default

h3. Expected Results
The most recent selected tab should be remembered when navigating to other transitions or re-opening transitions. This should work similar to the way tabs are remembered on a JIRA Issue.

h3. Actual Results
The Triggers tab is selected each time, forcing to re-navigate to the correct tab.

h3.Workaround
Manually navigate to the desired tab when editing a transition.
fields.summary: Tabs No Longer Remembered When Editing Transitions on a Workflow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47698].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

# Go to a Kanban board
# Click any task
# Hit "a"
# The "Assign to" dialog pops out
# The "Assignee" field is not focused, so you can't start typing a name and see the suggestions

Reproduced on:
* Firefox 45
* Debian Linux
* https://wikia-inc.atlassian.net/
fields.summary: Regression: "Assign to" dialog doesn't automatically focus the "Assignee" field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47696].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian,

When a role is created one can also enter an optional description. It would be very helpful if this description were also displayed when roles are managed since it helps the administrators to identify were users should go,

We need additional roles but want to limit the number of them by naming then in a generic way (e.g. "Custom Role 1") and instead use some more explanatory text in the description.
Since there is still no possibility to define project specific roles we think this is a good way to go in a large environment with almost 1000 projects.

Regards,
Dieter
fields.summary: Description of user roles is not displayed when users/groups are added to a role

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47695].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When linking an issue, currently the user will only receive 10 results when using the "search for an issue" option. This limit=10 is send on the request when pressing the search button and seems to be intentional.

Yet for some instances there are too many similar requests and the 10 issue limit leaves the end-user with a functionality that does not work as desired.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Let the administrator configure the amount of returned results.

h3. Workaround

Use the issue navigator to look up the issue which it has to be linked to, or use a more refined search term.
fields.summary: As an administrator, when linking issues, I would like to configure the amount of results that are returned when using the "Find JIRA issues" option.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47694].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently when assigning an issue the options available to the assignee field include:
* Unassigned
* Automatic
* And a list of some assignable users
However, there is no automatic way to directly assign an issue back to the reporter (assuming the reporter is assignable), except you have taken particular note of the reporter's ID, and manually enter this into the field. 

For workflows that often involve assigning issues back to the reporter, you may often have to go out of the assign issue dialog to verify the ID of the reporter from the issue view, before coming back to the Assign Issue screen to assign the issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option "Assign to Reporter" to the list of suggestions for Assignee field (provided the Reporter is assignable).
fields.summary: As a user I would like to have additional options like 'Assign to Reporter' for the assignee field
Include Custom Fields in Variable substitution in the webhook URL
Cannot read my ticket ID-1411 any longer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47690].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In JIRA 6.2, we used to be able to click on the gadget's name to go to the filter page.
In JIRA 6.4, the gadget's name is plain text. Due to this problem, users have to edit the gadget to get the filter ID displayed, and construct a query to go to the filter result page. This is too cumbersome.

In JIRA 6.2, we used to be able to refresh each gadget's status separately.
In JIRA 6.4, we need to refresh the dashboard.


h3. Suggested Solution
Please allow users to be able to 
- get the filter link from the displayed gadget.
- refresh each gadget separately


 
h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Hyperlink on the Issue Statistics gadget's name removed

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47684].
  {panel}

Hi,

What to enter in SVN while committing code in place of # resolve since JIRA has custom workflows.

Let's say: I use Dev Complete transition associated with QA In Progress Status that should appear exactly when I commit code in Tortoise SVN.

I've the Subversion ALM integrated with JIRA. It works fine if I enter #resolve in SVN that changes to Done state in JIRA for that issue ID.

Now I want to know what to be entered in case of custom workflows.

Thank you
Raghav

h3. Problem Definition
Users have created multiple shared filters however with the sharing option of "Shared with Everyone"; we would like to hide them all due to this feature request: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-23255

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability for an Administrator to bulk update all filters and set the sharing option accordingly
 
h3. Workaround 
- Ask user to change Sharing Option
- As a Site-Admin, [Log in As User|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/log-in-as-another-user-776994835.htm] and manually update share

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47669].
  {panel}

*Steps to recreate*
1.) Execute a filter to return results in excess of your Profile setting limiting the number shown on the 'current page'.
2.) Select Tools > Bulk Change: > all xxx issue(s)
3.) Select top-level checkbox, denoting all results should be changed.

*Expected Result*
All issues matching the filter and for which the user has permission should be selectable for Bulk Update.

*Actual Result*
Issues are limited by current page size.
fields.summary: JIRA 6.4.12 > Unable to Bulk Update All Issues returned in a Filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47668].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Issue Collector in JIRA is returning AJAX error in Safari, Mac OS.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Version {{7.1.0-OD-02}}
* Safari, Mac OS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access *Issue Collector* in JIRA.
# Fill in all the required fields.
# Click  *Submit*.

h3. Expected Results
Issue Collector works fine.

h3. Actual Results
The following error appears:
{noformat}
Oops! Something went wrong...
AJAX error thrown: SyntaxError: JSON Parse error: Unexpected identifier "XSRF"
Don't worry though! We've logged this problem and will look into it soon!
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
Use another supported browser such as Firefox or Google Chrome.
fields.summary: Submitting a bug via Issue Collector using Safari returns AJAX error
JIRA Should be able to Import projects with same version number
Ability to format all the lines at once in the comment field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47662].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When you access any dashboard in JIRA that is not in your list of favorite dashboards, you get the following prompt:
bq. This dashboard is not available in your Dashboard menu. To add it to the Dashboard menu, you need to add it as a favorite on the Manage Dashboards page.
This prompt can be dismissed but it will keep re-occurring every time you access a page that is not a favorite, even if you simply refresh the page after dismissing the pop-up.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Provide a way to disable this popup - either on a global level (which would apply to all users and all dashboards)
* or *preferably* as a personal setting (either made available under manage dashboards area or profile area); Or perhaps a "don't notify me again" option for each dashboard.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to be able to permanently disable prompts to add a dashboard as favorite

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47657].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the velocity Chart only shows the velocity of the team. The velocity can be estimated as the average, over several recent sprints, of the sum of the estimates for the amount of work completed by a team per sprint — For example, the velocity = (37 + 47 + 50 +57) / 4 = 48. However, we aren't given information of velocity value per member of the team.

h3. Suggested Solution
The velocity Charts should also include velocity value based on number of members. Eg: If there were 3 members in the team:
48 / 3 (people) = 16 (this is velocity value based on # of member of the team).
h3. Workaround
fields.summary: As an Admin, I want Velocity Chart to also display the velocity value based on number of members

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47656].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently we will have to one by one change the ownership of individual filters and dashboards from one user to anther. This could be extremely problematic once a person leaves the organization, therefore all his dashboards and filters that are used by others too will have to be changed ownership.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a bulk change option, to change ownership of filters and dashboards from one user to another.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I would like to bulk change ownership of filters and dashboards

Hi,

I am been using JIRA statistics view for a long time and when i logged into the one of our client space today Statistics view is broken and that view is no longer available today and showing a error message when i hit that.

  {panel}

*As a* Product Owner, *I want* an instant email notification when another member of the team creates a ticket in one of my Projects, *so that* I am immediately aware of the ticket and can process accordingly.

+Accetance Criteria+
*As a* Product Owner
*When* someone else Creates a Ticket in a Backlog I am subscribed to
*Then* I receive an instant email notification

*As a* Product Owner
*When* someone I Create a Ticket in a Backlog I am subscribed to
*Then* I do not get an email notification

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47642].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*
Currently in JIRA, when user scroll down until a certain point, the "Dashboards", "Projects" and "Issues" will be hidden.

*Suggested Solution*
Allow option in JIRA to make the bar which display "Dashboards", "Projects" and "Issues" to behave same way as the buttons in Issue page. In Issue page the the buttons are fixed on top of page while scrolling. Admins would like the JIRA bar to be fixable on top of screen as well.

Add an option in JIRA Administrator page to set this behavior.

*Workaround*
Currently there are no workaround for this.
fields.summary: Allow "Dashboards", "Projects" and "Issues" bar to behave like buttons in Issue page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47640].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition 

In the older version of JIRA, it used to have Component's Summary, Issue, Roadmap and  Change log. Those features are no longer exist in the latest JIRA and it would be great to have it again.
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira063/browsing-a-component-s-summary-683542555.html

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47632].
  {panel}

h3. *Current Behaviour*
In order to notify watchers at the moment, an action must be done on the ticket.

h3. *Expected Behaviour*
As a user, it would be nice to have a button to notify watchers with an issue (similar to to the ability to forward an issue to a set of e-mails) using a single click, instead of having to do an action to trigger the notification.
fields.summary: Button to notify watchers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47631].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA Catch Email Address field in Incoming Handlers is case sensitive to the local_part (before the at sign). That means that if the catch email is set to user@domain.com and an email is sent to User@domain.com, this email will be rejected, as the catch email won't match.

Though this is correct according to the RFC 2821, several email servers don't consider this part case sensitive. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Make JIRA Catch Email completely case insensitive. 

h3. Workaround 
You have have several version or emails addresses with different cases that are used, add a handler with a different catch email for each. For example:
* user@domain.com
* User@domain.com
* USER@domain.com
fields.summary: Make JIRA Catch Email Case Insensitive

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47628].
  {panel}

We have a Team in our organization that has a use case for managing permissions at a sub-project level (the term sub-project is being used loosely here - for their purposes it could be a component or a version, etc.).

Supposing there are user bases UB1 and UB2 (a set of users/groups/project roles), and sub-projects SB1 and SB2, and a hypothetical mapping that we have such that UB1 maps to SB1 and UB2 maps to SB2 - is it possible for us to set up permissions at the sub-project level such that users in UB1 would only see issues that correspond to SB1 and users in UB2 only see issues that correspond to SB2?

We would then want to extrapolate this such that one user base could map to multiple sub-projects and one sub-project could be accessible (i.e., the issues that correspond to the sub-project would be accessible) to multiple user bases and so on.

----
We have investigated the possibility of achieving this by using issue-level security in conjunction with JJUPIN scripts and have found that too complex and hard to maintain, especially with respect to scale. We have also investigated the [Issue Type Filter plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/net.youngaweb.jira.issue-type-ui-filter/server/overview], but found that it does not suit our purposes since our objective is not to limit a user base to a particular issue type, rather to create any issue type, but limit other users from seeing the created issues.
----
Thus, we were wondering if JIRA offered any way for us to have permission management at a component (sub-project) level such that visibility/management of issues could be controlled at that level as opposed to at a Project level. Or would the official recommendation in this case be to just create separate Projects for each of our sub-projects?

Thank you.
fields.summary: Permission Management at the Component Level
Window in small screen makes attaching screenshot impossible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47626].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
A new transition cannot be added to a status with no outgoing transitions to a draft workflow
Error *You cannot perform this operation on a draft workflow* shown.
h3. Suggested Solution
Make it possible to add a transition to the last status which does not have any outgoing transitions.
h3. Workaround
Edit the workflow in a disabled state (Inactive Worflow).
fields.summary: Cannot Add Transitions in Draft Workflows

  {panel}

*Problem Definition*
Admin would like to option to hide "You will lose access to Support and Updates in XX days" shown on top of JIRA page.

*Suggested Solution*
Add option in Administration to hide the notification of support licence expiration date.

*Workaround*
Currently there are no workaround for this.
fields.summary: Allow Admin to hide "You will lose access to Support and Updates in XX days"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47623].
  {panel}

Hi,

Jira has various permissions for "Work log feature", but we are missing a "view" permission. This is a feature request to make it possible to configure, which groups/roles can see the worklog related fields (estimation, remaining estimate, spent time)


This would remove much overhead if you work together with a customer, but he should not see the work log related stuff.

Regards
Martin
fields.summary: Add "view" permission configuration for work log fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47621].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, there is no sizing standard for image logo across products. For example if you go to _Administration >> Look and Feel_ in different products:

* JIRA, the height of the logo image will be constrained to a maximum of 30 px.
* Confluence, the height of the logo image will be constrained to a maximum of 48 px.

This causes a _small_ discrepancy in the logo quality across products, assuming all using the same image file.

h3. Suggested Solution

Standardise the resize image logo across _all_ products.
 
h3. Workaround

Resize the image logo manually before uploading
fields.summary: Standardise image logo sizing across all products

fields.description:
Saving a comment in JIRA Cloud displays the loader animation forever (see attachment), though the comment is actually saved.

Similarly the issues Resolve screen won't save and this won't save for good, see JS errors in attachment. This is basically breaking large of JIRA functionality for us.

To add insult to injury the service desk at https://my.atlassian.com is down too.
fields.summary: AJAX saves fail on JIRA Cloud (comments, resolution)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47618].
  {panel}

When calculating (checking) project permissions Permission helper (neither opened from the project page nor the one from the issue page Admin menu) doesn't consider "Granted to" items except "Project role". That says, that if the user A is in the X group and you give the ADD COMMENTS permission to this X group, there will be ability to add comments to this A user, but the Permission Helper says there is no permission because the A user does not have ... project role.

Example:
1. "Add comments" permission is added to toldot-CTO group and to Project Lead:
 !Снимок экрана (110).png|thumbnail! 
2. User nisbor is Project Lead and is a member of toldot-CTO group:
 !Снимок экрана (111).png|thumbnail! 
3. Permission helper in this project shows that threr is no ability to add comments to user nisbor:
 !Снимок экрана (109).png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Permission helper doesn't consider permissions to groups while checking permissions

fields.description: I believe this duplicates CLOUD-8460, but I want to make sure it is logged in the correct project. Thanks in advance for your attention to this blocking issue.

Normal email notification: !before.png! Notification with unrelated image from another project entirely: !after.png! The source for the image (not world visible) is: {code} ... fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47614].
  {panel}

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-255003

h3. Problem Definition

When navigating from the following path, the release notes do not work and throw an error regarding permissions and do not allow you to view.

www.atlassian.com
Support
Documentation
JIRA 6.4 and earlier
JIRA 6.4 Server Documentation
Release Notes
Production Releases
JIRA 6.1.9 Release Notes

h3. Suggested Solution

Resolve permissions issues that aren't allowing viewing.
 
h3. Workaround 

If you google 'jira release notes' and follow that link you can get to the release notes.
fields.summary: Cannot view release notes from JIRA 6.1.8 and above
Enable notification e-mails to be threaded (support in-reply-to header)
To-do lists (checkbox) for description field on tickets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47604].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*
JIRA Admin would like to be able to track how long a user log time in time tracking

*Suggested Solution*
Allow Admin to be able to track specific users logging time. For example:

If User A works part-time, lets say 3 hours per day, this means that in a 22-day sprint, he has 66 hours. If Project Admin then assign him 80 hours, it should be possible to easily see that Project Admin have given him too much work without having to manually add up the time.

And if Project Admin assign him 30 hours, he can see that Project Admin can give him more to do. And another member on the team works 8 hours a day, Project Admin would see that 200 hours is too much and 130 is too little.

*Workaround*
Currently there are no workaround for this.
fields.summary: Allow Admin to track individual users time spend in JIRA
JIRA server migration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47592].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The JIRA configuration can be set in a number of places : 
   # jira-config.properties
   # Settings and advanced settings in browser UI
   # Database 
   # Java properties (e.g. jira.home, mail.mime.decode and UTF-8 settings)
That makes it difficult for an administrator to manage all locations well and make sure everything is migrated at the time of upgrades or server migrations etc.

h3. Suggested Solution
Move the relative configurations under Settings or advanced settings in browser UI
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to disable the relative dates from the Advanced Configuration UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47591].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

When creating sub task from a parent task (i.e Story), it used to copy the {{Component}} from the parent issue. However it is currently not working as of the latest Cloud Release.

h3. Steps to Replicate

# Create a test project
# Create a Story
# Create a Component
# Assign _Component_ to the Story
# Create subtask 

h3. Expected Result

_Component_ is copied to Subtask

h3. Actual Result

Subtask created without _Component_ populated, no value is seen in the _Component/s_ field.

h3. Workaround

# Enable JIRA Suite Utilities 
# Add post function in the create transition, (select the text mode > select the first step > you will see {{create}} transition on your left)
# Select {{Copy Value From Other Field}}
# Click next, select {{Component/s}} as the source field and destination, for the option pick {{copy from parent}}
# Publish the workflow
fields.summary: Component is not copied to Subtask when creating a Subtask

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47590].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently if you have in the *Two dimensional filter statistics* x-axis a custom Field of type *cascade*, then we don't have an option to limit them to only level 1 of the cascade list. This will be an issue if customers only want level 1 data and not specific to level 2. 
!tdf.png|thumbnail!
Therefore according to the above there will only be A

h3. Suggested Solution
Give an option to specify only level 1 if a Cascade custom Field is selected for the x or y axis.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I want the Two dimensional filter statistics gadget to allows to to specify in x or y axis only level 1 cascade custom field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47589].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the word 'Add' on adding user button has been changed to 'Edit' in JIRA edit permission UI even though the functionality remains the same.  

h3. Suggested Solution
Change it back to Add since 'Add' word is more convenience to be used with adding user functionality.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I want the word 'Edit' on adding user button in project permission UI to be changed back to word 'Add'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47587].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*
Currently JIRA will display a default page when JIRA is down or page is broken.

 !404 Page.png|thumbnail! 

*Suggested Solution*
Allow users to add their own version of 404 page or allow then to edit the existing page.

*Workaround*
Currently there are no workaround for this.
fields.summary: Customize 404 page
Avatars of suggested users in user picker broken

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47584].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a JIRA Core user I would like to have an 'Issue Link Relationship' custom field type available with the same behavior as the 'Epic Link Relationship' custom field type (which is not configurable via the JIRA custom fields administration screens).

This would be especially helpful for issues with too many Issue Links in which the desired link might be hard to identify.

h3. Workarounds
* Use Issue Links.
* Use a URL Field custom field.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Core user, I would like to have an 'Issue Link Relationship' custom field type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47579].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently if JIRA if an attachment is not available in the attachments home directory, the JIRAs Health Checker would give an error message that the error message cannot be read. 

Other known reasons for this error message is due to permission issues in the directory.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the error message specific, like attachment cannot be eg " Attachment does not exist in filesystem". Therefore customers can easily diagnose and fix these issues when they see this error from the Health Checker.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I want Health Checker to specifically say if an attachment cannot be found rather than say "cannot be read"
